nodes.text: So your father was a member of a Thieves' Guild?
Oh yes, although he preferred to think of himself more as an "Acquirer of Unique Items" than as a thief.

options.text: Say Something Polite to Please Joel

nodes.text: I guess he'd be pretty proud of you right now. You are the best "Acquirer of Unique Things" at this university.
I would like to think so.

options.text: Say Something Clever to Learn More About Joel

nodes.text: So you're following in his footsteps to become a Chief Thief?
Oh, no... I would not like to be a Chief Thief. Too many people would hate me and want to take my place if I were in charge.
I would much rather work for a smart, ambitious Chief Thief who values my ability to be useful.
A Chief Thief needs to be clever and outgoing. He also needs to be strong and respected. You would make a most excellent Chief Thief. I would be happy to work for you.
Joel, if I become Chief Thief, I promise that you'll be my main minion and first flunky.
Like that will ever happen.
No, I suppose not.

options.text: Say Something Snarky to Rebuke Joel

nodes.text: I gather that you want to grow up just like your father - a petty thief. Won't Master von Urwald be pleased at how much effect his lectures have had upon you?
Oh, please, do not tell the Master that!
I like being here at the university. I do not want the Master to be angry at me.
I will be a Rogue - you will see.
I didn't doubt you. I just wondered if you doubted yourself.
How are things for you today?
It has been a good day for me, thank you.
What do you know about the Black Bird?
My father spent his whole life searching for it. He found the real one a couple of times, but someone rudely stole it before he could get his hands on it.
I came here to Sardonia to search for the Raven here. I wish to succeed where my father did not.
Do you have anything new for sale?
Ah, yes, I came across something very special that you might be interested in owning - a Necramulet! It protects against the Undead.
This can be very useful if you choose to explore the catacombs.
Did you pick up any juicy rumors?

I think you will be interested to know that there is a passage from the Sea Caves that leads into the Catacombs. Not far from that entrance, there is a crypt with the words, "Here lies Fester Edwin Savors, Proving Fences make good Neighbors."
Fester was once the major distributor for ill-gotten gains for Sardonia until he displeased a Goon by calling him a 'Dummy.' The Goon dropped a safe on poor Fester.

However, that unfortunate incident did not stop Fester from his noble task of buying and selling illicit items. Although he is most sincerely dead, he still runs a shop behind the crypt door. All you have to do is knock.

nodes.name: A Fence in the Catacombs
nodes.description: So there's a Thief Fence in the catacombs behind a crypt labeled, "Here lies Fester Edwin Savers..." That sounds like a really useful piece of information.

nodes.text: And of course, you need to know the password. But I value your friendship so highly that it certainly outstrips my normal fee for such information.
The benefits of friendship! What's the password?
The password is "pesce spada." I believe that you will find Fester to be a very valuable resource for any nefarious dealings.

nodes.name: Password for the Fence
nodes.description: The password to get into the Fence's shop is "pesce spada." I'll keep that in mind.

nodes.text: Thanks, but I'd rather figure it out on my own.
Well then, I wouldn't want to spoil your fun.
And of course, you need to know the password. I will be happy to share the password with you for a nominal fee of say, thirty-five Lyra?
There you go... so what's the password?
The password is "pesce spada." I believe that you will find Fester to be a very valuable resource for any nefarious dealings.

nodes.name: Password for the Fence
nodes.description: The password to get into the Fence's shop is "pesce spada." I'll keep that in mind.

nodes.text: I think I have better uses for my money.
Bye for now.
Take care of yourself.
